markdownRemark.html:
Examples can be confusing, especially when we assume they’re following some kind of best practices and that we can blindly rely on them. But we must keep in mind that code samples are just minimal setup to achieve a specific goal, and nothing else. It is not intended to be clean code but rather to be clear enough to demonstrate the purpose it serves.

Therefore, relying too much on examples as the right way to do something is not relevant. One good illustration of this is how the event handlers are named in react. Here is a piece of code you will probably be familiar with:

function handleClick() {
  // This function does something
}

function MySuperComponent() {
    return <Button onClick={handleClick}>Save</Button>;
}

frontmatter.title: How to name your event handlers in React
frontmatter.description: There might be a better naming than handleClick
